description: Triangle T(n,k) giving number of fixed 2 X k polyominoes with n cells (n >= 2, 1<=k<=n-1).
links: R. C. Read, Contributions to the cell growth problem, Canad. J. Math., 14 (1962), 1-20.
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_v C(n-k+1, 2*k-n-v)*C(n-k+v, n-k).G.f. (1+x*y)^2/(1-x*y)*1/((1-x*y)-(1+x*y)*x^2*y); - Christopher Hanusa (chanusa(AT)math.washington.edu), Sep 22 2004
maple: with(combinat): for n from 2 to 30 do for k from 1 to n-1 do printf(`%d,`,sum(binomial(n-k+1, 2*k-n-v)*binomial(n-k+v, n-k), v=0..k) ) od:od:
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n-k+1, 2*k-n-v]*Binomial[n-k+v, n-k], {v, 0, k}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 2, 15}, {k, 1, n-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 20 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 05 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 06 2001
